page.title: 13 A BARRISTER'S LIFE
page.content:
My name is Shaun Spencer. I am 41 years old and have lived in Wighill since 1976.
I am a barrister by profession, taking my degree in l965 and being called to the Bar in l968. Since then I have practised on the North Eastern Circuit from my chambers in Leeds.
I work in court most days, wearing robes of wig, gown, wing- collar and bands. Robes are oppressive in hot weather. Most of my court work is done in Leeds, but I also go to other cities. About half my work is criminal - the rest is 'civil'. The bulk of this is made up of personal injuries claims where compensation is sought. If I am not in court I do paper work in chambers. I enjoy my work.
